verses.roman:
vaibhava-prakāśa yaiche devakī-tanuja
dvibhuja-svarūpa kabhu, kabhu haya caturbhuja

synonyms: vaibhava-prakāśa—the feature of vaibhava-prakāśa; yaiche—just as; devakī-tanuja—the son of Devakī; dvi-bhuja—two-handed; svarūpa—form; kabhu—sometimes; kabhu—sometimes; haya—is; catuḥ-bhuja—four-handed.
translation: "An example of vaibhava-prakāśa is the son of Devakī. He sometimes has two hands and sometimes four hands.

purport.content: When Lord Kṛṣṇa took His birth, He appeared outside the womb as four-handed Viṣṇu. Then Devakī and Vasudeva offered their prayers to Him and asked Him to assume His two-handed form. The Lord immediately assumed His two handed form and ordered that He be transferred to Gokula on the other side of the River Yamunā.
